Photo: John Phillips, Getty Images, June 15 Selena Gomez: The Texas native brings her Revival Tour to... Image 21 of 21 Woodlands Pavilion is No. 1 in the world 1 / 21 Back to Gallery We're No. 1! In the world!
The Woodlands Pavilion tops a worldwide list of amphitheaters, based on the number of tickets sold so far in 2015, according to Pollstar magazine.
The Pavilion's ticket sales totaled 395,829 for concerts between Jan. 1 and Sept. 30, based on data compiled by the Pollstar trade publication. The Pavilion has ranked in the top five since 2010, but this is the first time it's topped the list.
The Pavilion boasts 15 sell-outs so far this year, including:
KSBJ Anniversary Show with MercyMe (March 28) Buzzfest 33 (April 18) Tony Bennett & Lady Gaga (April 24) Elton John (May 1) Lana Del Rey and Courtney Love (May 7) Dave Matthews Band (May 16) Disney in Concert with the Houston Symphony (June 12) Kid Rock (July 22) Chicago and Earth, Wind & Fire (July 25) 5 Seconds of Summer (Aug. 8) Incubus & Deftones (Aug. 19) J. Cole (Aug. 21) Def Leppard (Aug. 22) Van Halen (Sept. 25) Hall & Oates Sept. 26 Other venues on the Pollstar list include Red Rocks Amphitheatre in Morrison, CO at No. 2, Filene Center at Wolf Trap in Vienna, VA at No. 3, Klipsch Music Center in Noblesville, IN at No. 4 and Susquehanna Bank Center in Camden, NJ at No 5.
The Pavilion's 2015 season boasts nine more events, including Thursday's Counting Crows show, the Oddball Comedy Festival (Oct. 16) and Buzzfest 34 (Oct. 17).
